CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 19, 1954, page 21, reads: "The Courier Home Service Grand Prize Window - Ralph Ellison, representative of Tumpson & Company, presenting Mrs. Eva Roger one of the grand prizes - a Crosley Electric Dryer. Inset, Mrs. Mary Tanner, winner of the Bendix Electric Range, another grand prize. Winners of the A&P bushel basket of groceries are, left to right, Gerline Brown, B. Henderson, Mrs. Field, Mrs. Terry Knowels, Mrs. Alice Velar, Evelyn Spearman, William Purvis, Back row; A&P representatives, C. F. Muehlman and G. R. Hollman; Representative Harry Waugh presenting the Calvert Lo-Ball Glasses to winners Mrs. T. Taylor, Shirley Butler, Mary Hall and Mrs. Doris Brown; winners of the Beacon Furniture Company 60-piece set of Verde Moderna Dinnerware are, left to right, Daisy Reynold, Ethel Prysock and A. Velar; B.F. Williams, district manager of the Supreme Liberty Life Insurance Company, presents Mrs. Sally B. Thomas with a Dormeyer Fri-Well. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Ralph Ellison, presenting Eva Roger a Crosley Electric Dryer from Tumpson & Company at a booth with Mary Tanner, gathered in front of stage with an oversized Morton Salt container, in Hunt Armory for the 1954 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
